page.title: 02Lilias Day in Kilbarchan.
page.content: {Lilias Day}is a historical pageant which takes place on the first Saturday in June each year.{Baron {William Cunningham }named it Lilias Day in honour of his daughter of that name. A colourful parade of historical groups and decorated lorries moves through the village to the steeple where it is joined by the legendary piper {Habbie Simpson.}When the parade reaches the park, the School Queen who has been chosen by the pupils of Primary 7 is crowned by Miss Lilias. Miss Lilias then declares Lilias Day open.In the park there are stalls where you can buy or win things.There are also competitions going on throughout the day, and events to watch in the arena. At night people walk in procession to the steeple to see Habbie return to his resting place until Lilias Day next year.
